required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 1 Study to Evaluate Safety and Pharmacokinetics of FZJ-003 in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Dose-escalation and Food Effect Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerance, and Pharmacokinetics of FZJ-003 In Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized, double-blinding, dose-escalated phase 1 trial to evaluate the tolerance and fasting/postprandial pharmacokinetics of FZJ-003, an oral Janus kinase1 (JAK1) inhibitor.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: SAD and MAD: 6 cohorts, 8 subjects take FZJ-003 and 2 subjects take placebo; Food Effect on Phamocokinetics: 14 subjects, crossover designing
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Adverse events and the number of volunteers with adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability
primary_outcome.description: Tests will be performed to assess whether the study drug has any potentially adverse effect (laboratory tests on blood and urine for functioning of organs; ECG testing). Also, participants will carefully be monitored by medical staff for vital signs, and asked to report any side effect experienced in the course of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC)
Pharmacodynamics (PD) parameters of percent and actual change from baseline for a panel of JAK-dependent biomarkers

intervention.description: Subjects will receive FZJ-003 oral capsules in a dose escalation format.
Subjects will receive placebo oral capsules (matching FZJ-003) in a dose escalation format .

facility.name: the First Bethune Hospital of Jilin University
